channel.title: Data transfer on JASMIN Help Site
channel.description: Recent content in Data transfer on JASMIN Help Site
channel.copyright: Copyright Â© 2023 Science and Technology Facilities Council.

item.title: Globus transfers with JASMIN
item.description: NEW - December 2023 This article describes how to do data transfers using JASMIN’s new Globus endpoint (now called a collection ), based on the most recent version of Globus Connect Server.

item.title: Transfers from ARCHER2
item.description: This article explains how to transfer data between ARCHER2 and JASMIN. It covers: The choice of available tools / routes Example of how to use the currently-recommended method Choice of available Tools/Routes   See JASMIN external connections and Data Transfer Tools for general details.

item.title: Data Transfer Tools: GridFTP (certificate-based authentication)
item.description: This article describes how to transfer data using gridftp with certificate- based authentication. Basics of certificate-based authentication   Gridftp servers commonly use a network of “trust” based on electronic certificates.

item.title: Data Transfer Tools: bbcp
item.description: This article provides information about the bbcp data transfer tool. What is bbcp?   bbcp is a simple command-line tool which can use your SSH connection to transfer data in and out of JASMIN efficiently.

item.title: Data Transfer Tools: ftp and lftp
item.description: This article provides information about FTP (File Transfer Protocol) as a data transfer tool. In particular: what is FTP? where and how can I use FTP on JASMIN?

item.title: Data Transfer Tools: Using the Globus Command-Line Interface
item.description: This article describes how to transfer data using the Globus Command Line Interface. It covers: how an end-user can set up their host (laptop, desktop or home directory on their departmental server) with the Globus Command-Line Interface (CLI) examples of common tasks using the CLI It is not necessary to use the Globus CLI on a JASMIN server: it is a tool that you can use anywhere (for example your own desktop/laptop) to interact with the Globus service, to orchestrate a transfer between 2 endpoints.

item.title: Data Transfer Tools: Globus Web Interface
item.description: This article describes how to transfer data using the Globus Command web Interface. It covers: How to transfer files between two (dummy/tutorial) Globus endpoints How to use the JASMIN Globus endpoint Globus is a 3rd-party, cloud-based data transfer service for the research community.

item.title: Data transfer tools: Globus Connect Personal
item.description: This article describes: how to create your own Globus endpoint using Globus Connect Personal This would enable you to transfer files to/from another Globus Endpoint using any of the Globus Online transfer tools (Web app, CLI or [Python SDK](https://globus-sdk- python.

item.title: Data transfer tools: rclone
item.description: This article provides information about the rclone data transfer tool. In particular: what is rclone? installing rclone for yourself on JASMIN.

item.title: Data Transfer Tools
item.description: This article lists the data transfer tools available on JASMIN and provides links to articles that describe them in more detail.

item.title: Data Transfer Tools: rsync, scp, sftp
item.description: This article tells you about some of the basic transfer tools available for use with JASMIN that work over an SSH connection:

item.title: Scheduling/Automating Transfers
item.description: This article explains how to schedule or automate data transfers. It covers: Scheduling download tasks using cron and LOTUS Using Globus for transfer automation [TODO] Overview   In many cases it can be useful to fetch data from an external source for processing/analysis on JASMIN on a regular basis, for example “every Monday at 11:00 fetch all last week’s data”.

item.title: Data Transfer Tools: GridFTP (SSH authentication)
item.description: This article describes how to transfer data using GridFTP with SSH authentication. Introduction   GridFTP is the recommended tool for transferring large files or groups of files across high-speed Wide-Area Networks (WANs).

item.title: Data transfer overview
item.description: This article introduces the topic of data transfer to/from JASMIN. Introduction to Data Transfer on JASMIN   As a JASMIN user you are very likely to be involved in data transfer.

item.title: JASMIN external connections
item.description: NOTE [January 2021] This article is now out of date. Some terminology, names and components are no longer current. A newer version will be posted here in due course.

item.title: Data Transfer: high-performance data transfer access
item.description: This article explains about access to high-performance data transfer services. Applying for access   Some data transfer services are hosted in the JASMIN Data Transfer Zone for increased performance.
